result.execSummary:
The defendant Rogelio Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deft is eligible for expungement upon satisfying all court ordered obligations w/ motion to be filed.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay Prosecution Costs totaling $301.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rogelio Gomez

Per Judge Kerkman, the case will not be expunged as the DE still owes financial court obligations
Atty Moorshead called to inquire about the status of this case being expunged pursuant to motion hearing on 4/6/16; file forwarded to Judge
Dated 11/18/16 - IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to December 16, 2016.

Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement, filed by agent Erin Angel.  Def. has successfully completed probation and all court ordered conditions have been met.  All financial obligations paid in full.  Def. has not been convicted of a subsequent offense.
Terminated regular on 10/6/16
2/3/16 - Final Pretrial
Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.
Probation Review is canceled for 9/9/16 and any other unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Email correspondence received from Agent Erin Angel stating victim witness fees have been paid
received from Agent Angel stating the VW fees have been paid in full and requests hearing be canceled on 9/9/16.
Probation review hearing on September 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
4/6/16 - Motion Hearing

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 12/9/15 - Initial Appearance (Electronic Recording)
Copy of file sent to appellate Attorney Moorshead.
Request from Atty. Moorshead for CD recorded hearing of 12/9/15 to be transcribed sent to JT & RMM.

Notice sent to State Public Defender's Office 4/13/16.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Petition and Order for Other Prosecution Costs totaling $301.00
Exhibit S2 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 4/8/16. vm

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Rogelio Gomez, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
KPD Officer B. Miller is sworn in and testified.  Exhibit 1 is received.  Closing arguments made.  Upon hearing arguments motion to suppress is denied.  Atty Bielski requests a few moments off the record to speak with DE.  Parties appear back on the record and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    Court imposes a fine of $ 500 plus costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  In addition he is ordered to pay prosecution costs in the amount of $301 as stipulated.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE is eligible for expungement upon satisfying all court ordered obligations with motion to be filed.  Appeal Rights given
Motion hearing at 04-06-2016 02:00 pm
Due to a continued jury trial; Motion Hearing rescheduled to 4/6/16 at 2:00 PM and confirmed with Atty Bielski
FPT on 2/24/16 at 8:50 is removed from the calendar.  Defendant's motion to suppress evidence to be heard on 2/26/16 at 10:30.  Parties notified by email.
to Suppress Evidence filed by Atty Donald Bielski.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Bielski requests time to review the statute with def.  FPT adj. to 2/24/16 at 8:50.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(3g)(d) -Poss of a Controlled Substance

1:30 pm    Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Don BIelski.  Clerk:  JT.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  PTC 1-8-16 @ 1:40 & FPT 2-3-16 @ 8:40.  $1000 signature bond set with conditions.  Atty moves to dismiss case; arguments heard; motion denied.  /dls
